solution.text:
Profit percentage of the chocolate = (profit/initial price) x 100
Initial price = Rs. _{k}_
Final price = Rs. _{j}_
Profit = Final price- initial price = _{j}_- _{k}_= Rs. _{{j-k}}_
\( \Rightarrow \) Therefore, profit percentage = _{{((j-k)*100)/k}}_ %

content.text: What is the profit percentage on a chocolate sold at Rs. _{j}_ , if the initial price was Rs. _{k}_?
